snippet: Some members of Congress have demanded access to communications since 2012 between state attorneys general and climate change activist groups.
abstract: Rep Lamar Smith, Republican of Texas, has sent letter calling on New York Atty Gen Eric T Schneiderman to turn over any communications sent between his office and climate change activist groups; Smith says Schneiderman and other attorneys general are working at behest of environmental activists in investigating what Exxon Mobil knew about climate change, in questionable effort to show company's statements to public about environmental impact of its products might border on malfeasance.
lead_paragraph: Some members of Congress have demanded access to communications since 2012 between state attorneys general and climate change activist groups.

headline.main: State Officials Investigated Over Their Inquiry Into Exxon Mobil’s Climate Change Research
headline.print_headline: Dueling Climate Change Inquiries as Lawmakers Take On State Officials
